curam.util.client.domain.marshal
Class AbstractDomainMarshal

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.common.plugin.AbstractPlugIn
      curam.util.common.domain.AbstractDomainPlugIn
          curam.util.client.domain.marshal.AbstractDomainMarshal
All Implemented Interfaces:
DomainMarshal, DomainPlugIn, PlugIn
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddressMarshal, DateTimeMarshal, SimpleXPathMarshal, TextMarshal
public abstract class AbstractDomainMarshal
extends AbstractDomainPlugIn
implements DomainMarshal

A base class for domain marshals. By default, no preparatory processing is performed on the data and list paths are not supported.

Method Detail

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Gets the name of the plug-in. This is usually the simple name used to identify the plug-in when loaded. Many different plug-in classes may share the same name if they implement the same type of behavior. For example, "converter" may be used as the name of a plug-in that performs data conversion operations, but there may be different "converter" classes implementing these operations.

Specified by:
getName in interface PlugIn
Returns:
The name of the plug-in. This must not be null.

preResolve

public java.lang.Object preResolve(java.lang.String data)
                            throws MarshalException
Initializes a value for before paths are resolved. For complex domains, the "get" methods may be called several times, so it could be inefficient if they had to parse the data every time they had to resolve a value embedded in it. This method allows the marshal to perform this kind of preparatory processing once and to create an object that will be more suitable for use by the "get" methods. Any object can be returned, or the value string itself can be returned. The object will be passed to one of the "get" methods each time a path is resolved.

This implementation just returns the data string without changes.

Specified by:
preResolve in interface DomainMarshal
Parameters:
data - The string value to be prepared. This is the value that has been formatted by the converter.
Returns:
The object that will be passed to a "get" method when paths are resolved.
Throws:
MarshalException - If there is an error preparing the data.

getRaw

public java.lang.Object getRaw(java.lang.Object data,
                               Path path)
                        throws MarshalException
Resolves a path to a value embedded in a value of a complex type of domain. The raw, unformatted, value of the data is returned. It is not always necessary to provide a complex implementation of this method, as the renderer may perform this work internally. A renderer may perform the parsing or may use an XSLT stylesheet or other means. The data to be used to resolve the path is the object returned from the DomainMarshal.preResolve(String) method.

This implementation returns the result returned from the DomainMarshal.get(Object, Path).

Specified by:
getRaw in interface DomainMarshal
Parameters:
data - The data to used when resolving the path.
path - The path to be resolved. The root of the path is the data itself; it does not include the path steps that select the server interface property.
Returns:
The raw Object representation of the value that was resolved.
Throws:
MarshalException - If the path cannot be resolved.

getList

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getList(java.lang.Object data,
                                                Path path)
                                         throws MarshalException
Resolves a path to a list of values embedded in a value of a complex type of domain. It is not always necessary to provide a complex implementation of this method, as the renderer may perform this work internally. A renderer may perform the parsing or may use an XSLT stylesheet or other means. The data to be used to resolve the path is the object returned from the DomainMarshal.preResolve(String) method.

This implementation throws an exception. Sub-classes may override this method to proved an alternative implementation.

Specified by:
getList in interface DomainMarshal
Parameters:
data - The data to used when resolving the path.
path - The path to be resolved. The root of the path is the data itself; it does not include the path steps that select the server interface property.
Returns:
A list of the formatted values embedded in the complex object specified by the path.
Throws:
MarshalException - If the path cannot be resolved.

getRawList

public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getRawList(java.lang.Object data,
                                                   Path path)
                                            throws MarshalException
Resolves a path to a list of unformatted values embedded in a value of a complex type of domain. It is not always necessary to provide a complex implementation of this method, as the renderer may perform this work internally. A renderer may perform the parsing or may use an XSLT stylesheet or other means. The data to be used to resolve the path is the object returned from the DomainMarshal.preResolve(String) method.

This implementation calls the AbstractDomainMarshal.getList(Object, Path) method and returns the result as a list of Object elements.

Specified by:
getRawList in interface DomainMarshal
Parameters:
data - The data to used when resolving the path.
path - The path to be resolved. The root of the path is the data itself; it does not include the path steps that select the server interface property.
Returns:
A list of the unformatted values embedded in the complex object specified by the path.
Throws:
MarshalException - If the path cannot be resolved.

count

public int count(java.lang.Object data,
                 Path path)
          throws MarshalException

Gets the count of the values embedded in the complex object identified by the path. This may be more efficient than getting a list of values and then getting the size of the list if the list would not otherwise be used. The count will always be the same as the size of the list retrieved for the same path. Generally, where the DomainMarshal.getList(Object, Path) method would throw an exception, this method will also throw an exception, for example, if the path does not resolve to a list.

When iterating over the elements in a list, do not use this method in the loop condition to control the number of iterations, as it may be very inefficient to call it repeatedly. Instead, get the list of values and get the size from the list using java.util.List.size() or use the list iterator.

This implementation returns the size of the list returned by the AbstractDomainMarshal.getList(Object, Path) method.

Specified by:
count in interface DomainMarshal
Parameters:
data - The data to used when resolving the path.
path - The path to be resolved.
Returns:
The number of values identified by the path.
Throws:
MarshalException - If the count cannot be calculated.
